definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: I've been a faithful public servant all my life.
sentences.chinese: 我一生都是一名忠实的人民公仆。

sentences.english: Civil servant used to be a good job. The situation is different now.
sentences.chinese: 公仆曾经不一份理想的工作，现在的情况已经改变。

sentences.english: Anyone can be a servant. All it requires is character.
sentences.chinese: 其实每个人都能成为公仆，需要的仅仅是一种品性。

sentences.english: Introducing the concept of servant leadership to undergraduate teaching complies with the demands of Chinese contemporary university education.
sentences.chinese: “教师成为公仆型领导者”是美国新兴的教育理念。

sentences.english: See, public servant is afraid of public.
Does evil abuses power, that is the people's public servant.
sentences.chinese: 作恶作威作福，那是人民公仆。

sentences.english: Everyone wants to lead; no one wants to bea servant.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都想成为领导者，没有人愿意当公仆。

sentences.english: They are the servant leaders of Wal-Mart.
sentences.chinese: 他们才是沃尔玛的人民公仆。

sentences.english: She has always been a noble public servant," she said.
sentences.chinese: 她始终是一位品质高尚的公仆。

sentences.english: They were both able, honest public servants.
sentences.chinese: 他们都是能干而且正直的公仆。

sentences.english: China's a big place with abundant resources, especially when it comes to civil servants.
sentences.chinese: 中国地大物博，尤盛产各类公仆。

sentences.english: Scala was a meritorious public servant.
sentences.chinese: 斯卡拉是一个能干的国民公仆。

definition: Serve the People!, CCP political slogan
self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
the spirit or character of a political party
lit. both sleeves flowing in the breeze (idiom); having clean hands/uncorrupted/unsoiled by corrupt practices
Aimin district of Mudanjiang city 牡丹江市, Heilongjiang
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
to carry out official duties and observe the law
